results.title: A Christmas dream [English version]
results.creator_credit: Karel Zeman and United World Films
results.brief_description: A fantasy in which a little girl’s toys come to life in a dream - the toys being played by Puppets. (The film is noteworthy for the excellence of the puppet animation in the original material - for American distribution, introductory and concluding sequences have been added to the film by Castle Films, USA.). This film was directed by Karel Zeman at the Gottwaldov Puppet Studios, Czechoslovakia.

results.title: A Christmas Carol: Being a Ghost Story of Christmas
results.brief_description: This screen adaptation of Charles Dickens’ classic novel retains the essential ingredients of this well-known Christmas story of a mean lonely old man called Ebenezer Scrooge who refuses to join in the Christmas festivities. Scrooge is forced to face the truth about himself when confronted by the ghosts of his late business partner, Marley, and the Ghosts of Christmas Past, Present and Future. Dramatised by Elaine Morgan, stars Michael Hordern as Scrooge and John Le Mesurier as Marley.

results.title: A Chorus line
results.brief_description: Based on the stage play “A Chorus line”, here is a behind the scenes look at the experience of what it’s like to audition for a musical chorus line. Michael Douglas plays Zach, a chain smoking director holding auditions for his new show. Throughout the day we meet the hundreds of hopeful dancers that are slowly narrowed down to 16. It is at this point we are really introduced to the remaining dancers as they open themselves to Zach about their past and hopes for the future. A past lover of Zach’s, Sheila, once herself a star dancer who broke his heart by leaving town to be in a major show of her own, also turns up to audition. During the day Zach will push every boundary of these dancers to ultimately have the best chorus line of 8 for his show. Nominated for 3 Academy awards this is a vibrant and character driven movie adaption of a popular broadway play.

results.title: A Chord for voices
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Malcolm Otton, OTC Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In July 1976 a new undersea communications link was completed between Papua New Guinea, Australia and the rest of the world. Complicated cable laying techniques are shown, and in the background is the exotic and beautiful Papua New Guinea scenery. By plugging in to the international community, the indigenous people will feel greater pressure to surrender their traditions and customs, and to develop towards a more cosmopolitan way of life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: A Choice of two
results.creator_credit: John Howe and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: White-collar crime and corporate in-fighting merge as a chairman of the board must choose his successor from between two competent executives. All eyes are on the contenders when it is discovered that a defrauding of Farabee Industries is being orchestrated by someone within the arena of power. This drama was based on an actual case history and looks at an aspect of business ethics. Stars Leslie Nielsen. (Awards: Toronto)

results.title: A Chinese ghost story III = Sinnui yauman III [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Golden Princess Films
results.brief_description: ‘The Chinese Ghost Story’ series integrates ideas and images from Western horror films (using techniques and technologies developed in the Cinefex Workshop), with those from a classical Chinese story by Pu Song-Ling. In this part the Tree Devil from the first two parts wakes after a hundred-year sleep. Buddhism has gained its following in the Jiang hu (‘vagrant world’), a turbulent society ‘without rules’. A high priest and student monk are the custodians of a Sacred Golden Buddha which is transmogrified in the haunted Orchid Temple. The monks also go through changes as they encounter alluring demonesses and put the Tree Devil to the sword. Cast includes Tony Leung, Jacky Cheung and Wang Hsu Hsien. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: A Chinese ghost story II = Sinnui yauman II [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Golden Princess Film Production Ltd
results.brief_description: The story has its origins in a Chinese short story by Pu Song-ling which was also the basis of Li Hanxiang’s 1958 film, ‘The Enchanted Shadow’. The internationally successful trio of ‘Chinese Ghost Story’ films integrates ideas and images from Western movies and John Carpenter films with the classical Chinese story. Here, the plot takes up where part 1 leaves off, with Leslie Cheung as a wandering scholar turning his back on the gates of hell, only to find himself fending off attacks from a decomposing giant. He is drawn into guerilla action to free an unjustly imprisoned official and finds himself torn between the love of the official’s two daughters. The film is a mixture of high style, low comedy, steamy romantic interludes, spectacular special effects and rapid-fire editing. Cast also includes Wang Zu Zian (Wang Tsu-hsien) and Wu Ma (Wo Ma). In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: A Chinese Ghost Story = Sinnui yauman
results.creator_credit: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Cinema City Co, Film Workshop
results.brief_description: Leslie Cheung (Happy Together) stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon. Enlisting the help of a mysterious Taoist monk (Wu Ma), the young tax collector tries to free the girl’s spirit and lay it to rest before her eminent marriage to the evil mountain demon. Employing rapid editing, surreal imagery (including a demon with a giant killer tongue) and spectacular fight sequences, ‘A Chinese ghost story’ is a fine example of the kinetic energy and outlandish sensibility that is a staple of the Hong Kong fantasy genre. Also starring Joi Wang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: A Children's welcome
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: This film was made in honour of the Queen Mother’s visit to Melbourne on March 3rd, 1958. A performance for the Queen Mother, by the school children of Victoria, was staged at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with items arranged by the Physical Education Department and accompanied by the RAAF Band. Family and friends were gathered in the stands of the MCG to watch and cheer on the children. At the end of the performance, the Queen Mother toured in an open car around the MCG.

results.title: A Children's Fable
results.brief_description: Three children, inspired by a program they saw on television, dress up in costumes and set out in search for the Holy Grail. Begun as a game, their quest becomes a terrifying adventure from which emerges a parable of racial confrontation and moral rebirth.
